New Records: Carlos Rodon allowed four runs, three of which were home runs, in just 3 ¹/₃ innings as the Yankees’ supposed rotation advantage has turned on its head through two games.
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched like an ace and allowed just a solo homer to Juan Soto over 6 ¹/₃ innings.
Alex Vesia came in to get the final out with the bases loaded in the top of the ninth, as pinch-hitter Jose Trevino flied out to center.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees’ rotation struggles have been a key issue through two games.
The manager highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Dodger Stadium with a crowd reaction of 'Yankees suck’ from the Dodger Stadium crowd.
The final score of the game was 4-2.
Others: The number of hits the Yankees got off Yamamoto was just 1.
